output.conclusion: Upon completion of this course, participants will possess expert-level knowledge and practical skills in database management, enabling them to design, implement, and maintain robust and efficient database systems.
output.introduction: This course provides an in-depth exploration of advanced database management concepts and techniques, tailored for experienced professionals seeking to enhance their expertise. It covers topics ranging from advanced SQL and NoSQL database design to performance optimization, security, and emerging trends in database technology.

chapters.description: Explore window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), and advanced indexing strategies for optimizing complex SQL queries.
Learn about query execution plans, cost-based optimization, and techniques for rewriting queries to improve performance.
Design and implement efficient stored procedures and user-defined functions for encapsulating business logic within the database.
Compare and contrast different NoSQL database models (key-value, document, column-family, graph) and their use cases.
Design data models for NoSQL databases, considering factors such as scalability, consistency, and query patterns.
Explore the concept of polyglot persistence and strategies for integrating different database technologies within a single application.
Review core database security principles, including authentication, authorization, and access control.
Implement data encryption at rest and in transit to protect sensitive information from unauthorized access.
Configure database auditing to track user activity and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.
Develop comprehensive backup and recovery plans to minimize data loss in the event of system failures.
Implement high availability solutions, such as database replication and clustering, to ensure continuous operation.
Set up database monitoring tools to proactively identify and address performance bottlenecks and security threats.
Identify and resolve performance bottlenecks through query optimization, index tuning, and database configuration.
Optimize resource utilization and plan for future capacity needs based on performance trends and growth projections.
Utilize advanced performance monitoring tools to gain insights into database performance and identify areas for improvement.
Explore cloud-based database services offered by major cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP) and their benefits.
Automate database deployment, configuration, and management tasks using DevOps principles and tools.
Discuss emerging trends in database technology, such as in-memory databases, blockchain databases, and AI-powered database management.
